dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kazakhstan is sending a delegation to the US to talk about those import tariffs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kazakhstan is sending a delegation to the U S to talk about those import tariffs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan will send a delegation to the United States for consultations on import tariffs, Vice Minister of Trade and Integration Zhanely Kushukova announced, without specifying the date of departure, according to KTK.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, uh, Vice Minister Zhanely Kushukova made that announcement, but they haven't set a departure date yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, uh, Vice Minister Zhanely Kushukova made that announcement, but they haven't set a departure date yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan will send a delegation to the United States for consultations on import tariffs, Vice Minister of Trade and Integration Zhanely Kushukova announced, without specifying the date of departure, according to KTK.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the tariffs are no joke—they're at 27 percent, which affects about five percent of Kazakhstan's exports.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the tariffs are no joke-they're at twenty seven percent, which affects about five percent of Kazakhstan's exports.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is worth noting that Washington's new tariff policy affects about 5 percent of Kazakhstan's exports. The tariffs, introduced under Trump, amount to 27 percent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which adds up to, what, over 90 million dollars in potential losses every single year?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which adds up to, what, over ninety million dollars in potential losses every single year?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result, Kazakhstan may lose over $90 million annually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But here's the thing—they're not planning any kind of retaliatory tariffs in response.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But here's the thing-they're not planning any kind of retaliatory tariffs in response.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, Kazakhstan does not plan to introduce retaliatory tariffs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the reason is pretty fascinating. They can't just change their import duties unilaterally because they're part of the Eurasian Economic Union.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the reason is pretty fascinating. They can't just change their import duties unilaterally because they're part of the Eurasian Economic Union.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Changing Kazakhstan's import customs duties unilaterally is not possible because we are a member of the Eurasian Economic Union, and we have shared obligations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh right, so it's a collective decision with the other four member countries. They all have to agree on any tariff changes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh right, so it's a collective decision with the other four member countries. They all have to agree on any tariff changes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A common customs tariff is applied across five countries. So, if any duties are to be changed on imported goods, it must be decided collectively by all five.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So that means, like, even if they wanted to retaliate, they'd have to get everyone on board first.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So that means, like, even if they wanted to retaliate, they'd have to get everyone on board first.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And according to Kushukova, that's not even being considered at this point.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And according to Kushukova, that's not even being considered at this point.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At this point, such a question is not even being considered, the Vice Minister of Trade and Integration explained.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a tough spot to be in—losing that much revenue but not having the freedom to act alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a tough spot to be in-losing that much revenue but not having the freedom to act alone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder how these big multilateral unions balance individual national interests with collective agreements.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder how these big multilateral unions balance individual national interests with collective agreements.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It sounds like their main move right now is just to go and negotiate directly with Washington.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It sounds like their main move right now is just to go and negotiate directly with Washington.
